messages.message:
The 4 hour deployment window for dogfood and uat envs seems not sufficient to run all the downstream regression tests, impacting the cypress tests the most.
We will increase the deployment window from 4 to every 6 hour now and see how it goes. Thank you.

I spoke to @shaunak about this a couple weeks ago. He said he’d look into increase resourcing (app-tasks, database memory) in dogfood to allow our regression tests to get through all the work faster. The alternative we discussed was setting up a dedicated env for some of our regression tests, but we settled on trying to increase resources first. 

One downside of moving to 6hr deployments is that in a normal engineering workday, if there’s even one deployment failure, eng will lose the ability to test out their changes in the same workday.

```One downside of moving to 6hr deployments is that in a normal engineering workday, if there's even one deployment failure, eng will lose the ability to test out their changes in the same workday.```
Totally agreed. The window length increase is somewhat immediate solution to the cypress pipeline timeouts that we are trying over the weekend.

When we are trying increasing the resources, I can revert the window length back to 4 hours.
